CARDINAL . Law no . CARDINAL of DATE ( " the DATE Law " ) enables preventive measures to be taken against " persons presenting a danger to safety and public morals " . That PERSON is summarised in its essentials in the PERSON judgment of CARDINAL DATE ( Series A no . CARDINAL , pp . CARDINAL , paras . CARDINAL - CARDINAL ) , and it will accordingly suffice to cite here only section CARDINAL , as amended by Law no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ( translated from the NORP ) :

" If the application [ for a preventive measure ] is for an order for compulsory residence in a specified locality , the presiding judge of ORG , during the procedure ... , may , where there are particularly serious grounds , make a reasoned order ( provvedimento motivato ) that the applicant be held in prison until the preventive measure has become final .

At the same time as it makes the order for compulsory residence in a specified locality , the court shall order that [ the person concerned ] be taken by the police from the prison in which he is being held to the place of compulsory residence and handed over to the local police authorities . "
